physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Progressive atrophy of the external genitalia; penis consisted of a small skinfold with practically no palpable corpora; both testes were inguinal, and the scrotum was hypoplastic.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive involution of the external genitalia despite testosterone treatment beginning at 6 months of age.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Development of micropenis, hypoplastic scrotum, and both testes ascending to high scrotal position despite hormone replacement therapy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression of symptoms indicating worsening condition, leading to both testes being unmeasurable in hormone levels.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Development of hypoplastic scrotum and lack of penile growth; external genitalia progressively embedded in prepubic fat, testes ascended to a nonpalpable position.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive embedding of external genitalia in prepubic fat; treatment with testosterone initiated at 9 months significantly improved genital development.
